questions.question: What are the two types of nano-LMOFs mentioned in the text?
What is the effect of substituting NH2 groups into the skeleton of tetratopic carboxylic acids?
questions.answer: It induces significant emission bathochromic shift and leads to unique properties and active sites for applications.

questions.question: True or False: The size of nano-LMOFs can be controlled by varying the linker structure and the amount of acid modulator.
What is the emission range of the nano-LMOFs mentioned in the text?
How does the introduction of hydroxyl and amino groups affect the resultant LMOFs?
questions.answer: It has a remarkable effect on the emission of the resultant LMOFs and leads to unique properties for their applications.

questions.question: True or False: The NH2-substituted LMOFs exhibit the same fluorescence response toward tryptophan as the non-substituted ones.
What is the purpose of using different volumes of acetate acid in the synthesis of nano-LMOFs?
questions.answer: To control the size of nano-LMOFs from dozens to hundreds of nanometers.

questions.question: True or False: The emission wavelength and crystal size of nano-LMOFs can be well controlled by varying the linker structure.
What is the detection limit of HIAM-4011 for tryptophan?
What is the role of formic acid in the synthesis of nano-HIAM-4022?
questions.answer: It is used as a modulator to form csq type MOFs and control the size of nano-HIAM-4022.

questions.question: True or False: The emission properties of nano-LMOFs are unaffected by the polarity of solvents.
What is the detection limit of HIAM-4023 for tryptophan?
How does the emission response of NH2-substituted LMOFs towards tryptophan compare to non-substituted ones?
questions.answer: NH2-substituted LMOFs exhibit opposite fluorescence response towards tryptophan compared to non-substituted ones.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of nano-LMOFs with controlled sizes and emission properties is not possible.
What is the significance of the linker design in the synthesis of nano-LMOFs?
questions.answer: Linker design is crucial for achieving full-color emission nano-LMOFs with tunable emission and size.

questions.question: True or False: The fluorescence response of HIAM-4011 and HIAM-4023 towards tryptophan is due to the aromatic nature and larger indole moiety of tryptophan.
What is the thermal stability range of HIAM-4022?
What is the effect of substituent groups on the emission red-shift of linkers?
questions.answer: The order of emission red-shift caused by substituent groups is NH2 > OH > H.

questions.question: True or False: The nano-LMOFs synthesized can only be used for tryptophan detection.
What potential applications are mentioned for the nano-LMOFs?
questions.answer: Photocatalysis, biosensing, bioimaging, and photodynamic therapy.
